msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 200 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 21; Text: Q 2:73-Q 9:77; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 400 x 295 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 11: "30 E. H. 21 Kur’an’ın ilk s̠ülüs̠ü Parşömen. 295mm boy ve 400mm eninde cönk şeklinde 200 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî ile 300mm uzunl.[uğunda] 14 satır. Tahmine göre II-III. (VIII-IX) asırda istinsah edilmiştir. Cildin alt kapağının içinde sahabeden Zayd b. S̠ābit’in elyazısı olduğunu bildiren Türkçe bir yazı vardır. Duraklar tezhiplidir. Miklep ve şemseli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu mushafı şerif Baḳara (2) suresinin 73. ayetinin son kısmı olan آياته لعلكم تعقلون ibaresiyle başlar ve Tavba (9) suresinin 77. ayetinin يلقونه بما kelimeleriyle sona eriyor."

This can be translated as follows: "30 E. H. 21 The first one-third of the Qurʾān Parchment. 200 junk shaped leaves of 295 mm height and 400 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 14 lines. Probably copied during 2nd-3rd (8th-9th) centuries. On the lower cover of the binding, there is an inscription in Turkish stating that it is the handwriting of Zayd b. Thābit, one of the companions. Illuminated verse separators. Cherry brown leather binding with flap (miklep) and mandorla (şemse). The codex begins with the words آياته لعلكم تعقلون of the last part of Q 2:73 (Sūra al-Baqara) and ends with the words يلقونه بما of Q 9:77 (Sūra Tawba)."
